thread.title: Joel Embiid danced on stage with Meek Mill
thread.title_full: Joel Embiid danced on stage with Meek Mill

author: USA TODAY
title: Joel Embiid danced on stage with Meek Mill
text:
Joel Embiid danced on stage with Meek Mill Joel Embiid says he won't stop having fun. Post to Facebook Joel Embiid danced on stage with Meek Mill Joel Embiid says he won't stop having fun.  //ftw.usatoday.com/2017/02/joel-embiid-76ers-knee-injury-meek-mill-concert-dance-shirtless-video-fun-trust-the-process/   Join the Nation's Conversation   Joel Embiid danced on stage with Meek Mill Alysha Tsuji , USA TODAY 8:06 p.m. ET Feb. 11, 2017 1 Shares 
Joel Embiid had a lot of fun dancing on stage in Philly. (Photo: Matt Steadman, Twitter) 
Joel Embiid isn't letting an injury stop him from throwing his shirt off while dancing on stage at Meek Mill's concert in Philadelphia on a Friday night. 
Embiid shared footage on his own Instagram Story, and of course, many other videos were shared on social media. Trust the Process pic.twitter.com/dBJYQpl3ql — Alysha Tsuji (@AlyshaTsuji) February 12, 2017 That dude @JoelEmbiid know how to get a crowd going #PHILLY #TrustTheProcess pic.twitter.com/x1PcsSFHYA — Matt Steadman (@msteadman1) February 11, 2017 Some video of Joel Embiid dancing shirtless to Wicked at Meek Mill's concert in Philly tonight. pic.twitter.com/p8dHH91Oco — Jake Pavorsky (@JakePavorsky) February 11, 2017 
I know what you're thinking, well, you're either thinking, "Trust the process! Woohoo, go Joel Embiid - my hero!!!!" or, "NOOOO, WHAT ARE YOU DOING?! You're injured!!" 
Maybe more are now thinking the latter since on Saturday news broke that Embiid has a "very minor meniscal tear," and not a bone bruise, as was previously reported . He hasn't played in a game since Jan. 27. Colangelo said Embiid's MRI after injury vs. Portland revealed "very minor meniscal tear." — Jessica Camerato (@JCameratoCSN) February 12, 2017 Colangelo on Embiid meniscus: "It was not thought to be acute & it was not thought to be the source of the pain, inflammation or symptoms." — Jessica Camerato (@JCameratoCSN) February 12, 2017 Colangelo on Embiid meniscus tear: "It's not thought to be an acute injury, meaning likely or could have been pre-existing." — Jessica Camerato (@JCameratoCSN) February 12, 2017 
However, Embiid has an answer to anyone hating on him for dancing on stage with Meek Mill: He says he's 23 years old, that he's been doing things like this the whole year and he's not going to stop having fun. Video from shootaround: Embiid on the Meek Mill concert pic.twitter.com/5qmIIueO5k — Jessica Camerato (@JCameratoCSN) February 11, 2017 
So yes, Embiid is injured, and it seems worse than originally thought, but no, he will not stop doing things that young people do. 76ers fans, you know what to do - trust the process.
